section.title: LDIF editor
section.para: The LDIF editor could be used to edit LDIF files. It could handle LDIF content files as well as LDIF change files. Files with appendix *.ldif are automatically handled by the LDIF editor.

Note: The LDIF editor is still in development. The handling of big LDIF files is a problem because the complete file is loaded into memory which may cause an OutOfMemoryException. The syntax check doesn't work correctly. The error annotations and displayed messages are not very helpful at the moment. Currently there is no URL support (jpegImage:<file://)

simplesect.title: Use LDIF editor
simplesect.para: To create a new LDIF file choose File -> New , expand LDIF Browser, select LDIF File and press the Finish button. To open an existing LDIF file choose File -> Open File, that opens a file dialog where you could select the LDIF file. Within Eclipse you could also open a LDIF file from Navigator view. To save the modified LDIF choose File -> Save or File -> Save as and select a save location and enter the file name. The LDIF editor also supports default editor functionality like Copy/Paste, Undo/Redo and a Find/Replace dialog, see Edit menu.

simplesect.title: Connect with directory and its schema
simplesect.para:
The LDIF editor could be connected to a directory server and its schema. A prerequirement is that the connection is defined in the
Connections view . Then you could select a connection from the drop-down list. Doing this will provide you the following features:
The Content Assistent will provide better attribute proposals.
The best value provider is choosen as default value editor.
The LDIF file could be executed, just press the the execute button.

simplesect.title: Content Assistent
simplesect.para: The LDIF editor provides a context-sensitive content assistent. To start content assistence press Ctrl+Space, a popup with proposals is shown. You could select one using the cursur keys or the mouse, press Enter to apply the selected proposal. To close the popup press the ESC key. The following list shows the supported proposals:

listitem.para: When starting a new record a popup with record templates is shown.
When writing an attribute in a content or add record a popup with a list of matching attributes is shown.
In an modify record the popup lists possible modify items.

simplesect.title: Value Editors
simplesect.para: In LDIF values may only contain a subset of ASCII characters. Values with other characters (like accent mark) and even asiatic characters must be encoded using BASE-64. Also binary data like images or certificates must be encoded.

To edit such values the
Value editors
could be used.

To start a Value editor move the cursor to the attribute or value and select Edit Value from context menu or press F7. This opens the default value editor dialog. You could also open a custom value editor by choosing one from Edit Value With in context menu.
To apply a modified value press the OK button in the value editor dialog, the previous value is replaced by the new value. Of course in LDIF they are displayed BASE-64 encoded.

simplesect.title: LDIF record editor
simplesect.para: It is possible to use the well-known Entry editor to edit content records and add records. Move the cursor to the record and choose Edit Record from context menu or press F8. This opens the LDIF record editor. You can add, modify and delete attributes. To apply the modification press OK, the previous record is replaced by the new one.

simplesect.title: Formatting
simplesect.para:
To format the document or the selected record according the
LDIF Editor preferences
choose Format from context menu.

simplesect.title: Folding
simplesect.para:
Multi-lined comments, records and multi-lined values could be folded. There is a (+) and (-) in the left ruler to collapse and expand these. By default multi-lined comments and multi-lined values are folded. This behaviour could be changed in
LDIF Editor preferences .

simplesect.title: Line numbers
simplesect.para: To show/hide line numbers toggle the Show Line Number in the context menu of the left ruler.
